definition[0]: to pay a lot of money for something
example[0]: Why is it always me who has to pay out?
example[1]: Altogether he had paid out almost Â£5000 for the improvements.
definition[1]: if a company or organization pays out, it gives someone money as a result of an insurance claim, investment, competition etc
example[2]: Insurance companies were slow paying out on claims for flood damage.
definition[2]: to let a piece of rope unwind
definition[3]: to give a person or company money you owe, especially when it is a large amount
example[3]: Mutual funds are required to pay out a quarterly cash dividend.
example[4]: The price increase was based on an analysis of the revenue that Chase receives and the fees it pays out.
